headline: Great place to learn and grow
pros:
My boss took a chance on me (not having a lot of prior experience) and trusted me on high-stake projects. I was able to grow and become a much stronger designer. 

I have been able to work on a wide range of projects that let me develop the skills that I have wanted to develop. 

Employees are rewarded for their hard work. I was promoted within a year of joining. 

The creative team is full of wonderful people that I am honored to work with. Everyone is very open, collaborative, and respective. I have made friends with teammates that I will cherish beyond work.

Time off is valued. We get extra days off during the holidays and for our birthday!
cons: As with all agencies, the clients have the final say in the work. Great clients are open to any and all suggestions, while some can be less open.

headline: Fraud company all fools are there in company
pros:
WFH
Sat sun off
Paid leaves
MNC
IT company
cons: Please before joining this organisation make sure you read the reviews. The HR team is total nonsense. They sent me the offer letter asked me to resign in my current organization and due to delay in submission of only one document, they revoked my offer. After requesting them so many times they dnt even bothered to revert me. This is what an IT culture is? Dnt give a damn to the candidates, even if their career is getting spoilt because of you. Worst company and HR team I have seen in my career.

headline: Not bad, but could be way better
pros: good salary, flexible working hours
cons: code quality on projects is far from ideal

headline: Quantity over quality
pros: Not for me, but others may think that it's beneficial not to have a good, strong company culture, so one can hide. Good for introverts.
cons:
- geographically fragmented teams (lots of devs from India, US and EU too) and teams are not co-located at all, we had timezone issues all the time
- company has no processes, it's driven by micromanagement
- no one really cares about the quality of the code, or its maintainability; the attitude is that it just must be done as soon as possible
- not too many seniors I met, only juniors and mediors, even if they call themselves senior
- they do not take seriously any Scrum/Agile methodologies, I did not have any retrospective meeting for a year!
- if you are good, you're going to be frustrated by the low quality code they produce

headline: Average to good level company to work

Management observes your efforts. 

As a QA member you got chance to interact with your clients directly and explore your work. 
QA process is unnecessary exposed just for status, it may be difficult for new guys. But once you get into it you are in.
cons:
Don't believe on Recruiting team words only believe on paper work.
Few Project Managers may fight with QA to change the understanding on "what is Regression defects."
Tight timelines for QA on almost projects.. 
No place of QA efforts in project planning.
Long hierarchy e. g. - Jr. Qa, QA, Sr. QA, lead associate, Lead, sr. Lead, Geo leads, QA manager etc etc. 
Observed regional (Chennai) political obsessed people

headline: Join at your own risk
pros: Initial pay (if you come as a experienced person), they will pay a good amount of money to procure you. No holding back in that. That’s the only “Pros”!
cons:
Work culture : they don’t have a culture, they don’t exhibit culture. You are treated as you should not be. If you abide by their absurd restrictions, you will prosper. Some of the big names here are people who don’t hesitate a min to backstab anyone for growth. 
Stability: they may claim to have good clients but they don’t have a vision, they are not built to sustain, they work on short term gains. Explains why they are calling themselves a “startup” even after a decade.
HR: we should call them admins. They are powerless. And they are clueless. We can replace them with class 10 folks
And
Management: Four guys remain a constant at the top
So does the CEO. The crew of people reporting to them are slaves, the rest who dare to differ are “fired”. They don’t fire instantly. They will gradually insult, pull you dow , place you in a spot beyond which no self respecting person would want to stay.

headline: BORN Group is one of the best places to work
pros: BORN is a really great place to work. I like it because it lets people work to their strengths, promotes from within, if people have an idea and it is good, it gets implemented. We go to conventions and happy hours and get certifications. It is fast-paced and everyone has a voice. We are constantly learning. It has been a home to me for over 3 years and I love it. It is the most adult, autonomous work environment I have ever worked in. If you are getting your work done and attending your meetings - you can work on your schedule.
cons: It isn't a 9-5 company. You might get a Slack at 8 pm. You don't have to be working late but we do respond to each other in real-time when we aren't on PTO. It is a lot of work, but we are so good at promoting and letting people do what they love and are good at!

headline: Run!
pros: Interesting clients to work with based on the history of the company. There are many talented people but it takes time to find out who is just getting a paycheck and who is talented.
cons: This was the worst company I’ve ever worked for. There is no onboarding at all and you are expected to be an expert at all the systems on day 2. When you ask for help you are belittled and made to feel like you are an idiot. Project audits and processes are for the sake of process and do not provide value to the clients. In one month I had 1 project audited 3 times and was written up because a previous project manager did not make sure documentation was complete and I was not provided access to the repository (I had asked multiple times). Management does not support employees and there is no resource manager so you’ll spend days trying to see if anyone has a resource when you need to replace someone. Just don’t apply if you’re looking for a place that has organization or any sense of a proper onboarding process or if you’re looking for any kind of support from your manager.

headline: No regrets but I wouldn't go there if given a second chance
pros: Content writing and curation training was excellent. It's a great office inside Ramannujan IT city.
cons: Open discrimination against minority and the management passively encouraged it. The office is embarrassingly filled with savarna Hindu folks. There's absolutely 0 job security; a team of 13 members were reduced to 4 within a span of 10 months. This was due to lack of projects and the management wanted to cut costs.

headline: Fantastic Company To Work For!

They work hard, but get the job done brilliantly. The benefits are great, and they're always adding more to help with the current challenges in a work environment. BORN isn't perfect, but they listen to what's not working and do what they can to make it better.
cons: Still working out some of the kinks, but every company has those. The pro's definitely outweigh any con that could come to mind.

Always, the tech team taking the driver seat may not be good for long run!

headline: A company with full of fake promises
pros: I can't think of anything that is good apart from the fact that its in the heart of the NYC.
cons:
The development team expect a lot from the employees. There are teams divided with in the office. There is one team who are all from one part of the continent who sit together and rest of the team sits elsewhere.

There is no concept of performance review, no proper management. Lot of promises are made but none are met. It is not professional. There are lot of internal politics within the team. There was no bonus or hikes. There was definitely no appreciation. 

The lack of transparency is appalling. It's always shown that things are perfect and we are the best company out there but in the interim it was not and we lost so many projects due to this reason.

headline: Good Company To Work

1) You can gain knowledge as you can challenge yourself to do the best
2) Good work culture
3) Good for freshers to explore more.
4) More projects on multiple e-commerce technologies like Hybris, Magento, Salesforce etc..
5) Always get help from the team
cons: No big client projects. No SAP integration projects for Hybris.

headline: Do not recommend - do your thorough homework before joining
pros: - Openness to provide opportunities on very few technologies they have
cons:
- they do not have many projects & whatever projects they have are of small size
Because of this no capability has been built in executing large scale assignments. Projects are delivered to make clients happy & retain them , do not see anything else is being given importance. Everything else (standard practices, guidelines, quality , honesty, integrity) is compromised from hiring till execution of project.
- HR team is under huge pressure for hiring as most of the people leave within year after joining so they have tendency to make false promises & play various tactics till during your notice period.
- Project allocation practices are not fair & open and being controlled by few set of old timers. You are going to suffer a lot if if are not on their good books.
- Do not get lured by their star HR team during hiring process , do thorough study before joining here.
- Do not see big future for this comapny on broader level.

headline: Great company to work for!
pros: Very well structured and great culture!
cons: Highly dynamic and fast paced environment

headline: Going downhill fast
pros: The people are good and so is the industry. The everyday people that make up the company are really good.
cons: The upper management is a disaster. It is cliquey and secretive. Turn over is a problem. HR has been brought to the US and it is worse than ever. It is become political - with only one opinion being perceived as correct and company wide. I have never worked as such an unprofessional place where things are so uncomfortable and uneven. Talented people are pushed aside. If you have the right political opinion yet aren't performing your voice is heard. A perceived high-performer's behavior is gross over and over again and it is looked past because it is considered funny by that department.

headline: Just another IT company, not better than TCS
pros: I didnt find anything yet beside salary (which depends on negotiation, if you are switching ask more than 60% raise).
cons:
1. Actuall work hours not 8.5, but around 10.
2. No flexibilty in work hours.
3. Saturdays are officially off, but people work do 5 to 6 on the same.
4. No WFH policy, hence worst experiance.
5. Useless and bulky internal process, you need to  update 5-10 places to just apply for leave.
6. No complimentary holiday policy, but thwy expect you to work in weekends.
6. 2 Years Non Competion Agreement which restrict you do anything after leaving this company.

headline: Nice on the outside, but it's very different inside of the organization.
pros: Good office location, somewhat flexible hours.
cons:
The high turnover is there for a reason. 
Lack of well-trained, empathic, and smart leaders. 
No benefits, no 401K, almost no employee development, and an unspoken male-dominated vibe is very present. 
HR and IT are based in a different country, which creates more challenges than is Born willing to admit.

headline: Front end developer - working for more than 5 years in BORN
pros: Work Life Balance, Flexible timings, Annual Day celebrations and events, Team Lunch and team outing.
cons: Salary is very very low compared to market. No Career growth. Same old tech stack. No new technologies here.  You will not get a proper hike until u put paper. Management will call and talk about your concerns only if u put paper, otherwise they wont even consider our issues.  There are people who work day and night and still get low hikes. If you are really good in praising manager to the skies,  you will get promotion and hike. No talent based promotion here.

In a nut shell for a techie like me, if you want to learn and work on niche skill projects and willing/open to cross train to upcoming technical platforms, then this is THE place!

headline: Amazing people, interesting projects

Almost every roll comes with both a lot of agency and a lot of expectation, so if you are self-motivated and enjoy independence you will love it.

headline: Worst company I have ever worked for
pros: There is nothing positive about working for this company at all

No pay rises (even in line with inflation) but expected to take on more and more work, whilst the managers line their pockets and don't care about their own staff only themselves. No Benefits, no career opportunities. Terrible offices and working environment. Really dismal miserable place to work. Since I have worked here they have lost quite a few accounts due to their low morals.

headline: Awesome 3 Years at BORN Group

Thank You BORN for everything..!!

headline: Nice experience with most of them in Born
pros: I have applied and appeared for a discussion with BORN and I wanted to feel the real approach for my expectations in born. Have around 7 years experience and worked for Wipro and have masters from UK. Wanted to do a combi role of a PM/client management & a BA role which had suited me well to decide to join them. from first call to offer and more importantly they had invited me to join for a lunch meeting where all senior guys came and spoke for few minutes and explained where I will be in few years. Kind of great experience and they had sent me a flower baskets with sweets on my date of joining. Its been a weeks now and every thing is going good and people are very good here.  Plenty of career opportunity and every employees talks very high about the company. that is the strength for any growing organisation
cons: seating arrangements :). not giving digital organization feel. lunch hall is full always. employees working environment can be made better

Attention given to every candidate before and after joining is one of the plus here.
A great place to learn. 
Very Transparent organisation. you can reach out to anyone.

headline: Good Opportunities
pros: The opportunities provided across ecommerce platforms are awesome
cons: There is no work life balance

headline: BORN Intern 2017
pros: An amazing place to gain knowledge professionally and personally. Amazing HR team who is always there for guidance irrespective of how many silly doubts you have. Truly an amazing experience. Super enthu leadership team always up for innovation and creative ideas.
cons: No downsides of working with BORN

headline: begining my 4th year
pros:
The momentum is still as fast as always
Learning is continuous
a place for improvisation
4 years have been a great learning, backed with ample opportunities
cons: PMS should be followed my managers effectively, so that the HR and leadership will be able to roll out appraisals at the apt time.

headline: Go Pune Go..!! BORN is expanding in Pune
pros:
BORN Pune is expanding exponentially. We Inaugurated a new office last week and the day was full of excitment and enjoyment. 
Got to know that the pipeline of the joiners in the coming days is very long. Hope to set a new benchmark soon. Proud to be associated with BORN
cons: I have Nothing to say here.

headline: Great place to work
pros:
Good Work Life Balance.
Every day learns something new.
Takes care of Employee.
cons: Nothing yet. Overall good experience

headline: Cool company, fun place to work.
pros: Good ambiance, salary, friendly team. The HR team is also very helpful. Organization is superb. Fun activities are held for all festivals and special occasions.
cons: Cafeteria, Saturday working, long hours of work,  no cab facility, fewer holidays. But these factors pale in comparison to the pros.

headline: Used to be great
pros: Fellow employees are the reason I stayed longer than I should have.
cons: Management used to care, not so much anymore. Not as many interesting and engaging clients as their used to be.

headline: Summer Internship Review
pros: Amazing atmosphere everyone is very friendly and eager to help.
cons: Nothing this place is amazing.

headline: Excellent Company For Growth
pros: Enormous opportunity to learn. Very high visibility which in turn result in quick growth.
cons: Have to perform to remain on top

headline: Avg company
pros: work and life balance can be handled easily.
cons: no motivation for the emp

headline: Good company to work
pros: You will get good compensation if you are good at your work.
cons:
Office Space, and Cafeteria need to be improved.
you will be respected until and unless you are billable.

headline: Stop writing self reviews
pros:
- Good place to learn technology
- Very great Technical Leadership
- Challenging work environment
- Lot of learning opportunities
cons:
- Worst Organizational Culture
- No Work-Life balance. You should just forget your family & personal life.
- No proper recognition
- Worst Process (actually no proper process is being followed)
- Huge favoritism  

**IMPORTANTLY: A COMPANY WHICH SETS TARGET OF WRITING MINIMUM 2 GOOD REVIEWS PER PERSON IN GLASSDOOR - don't ask to prove, i can tell the names of the team which writes all these reviews here.

headline: Just do it!!!
pros:
- Aggressive team of leadership and managers, they tune the joinees to speed, taking things to closure.
- BORN is a place meant for people who does not contain themselves with just a job, instead its a place to build once calibre and knowledge
- BORN is not a place for one's who is timid, less eager to learn and one who thinks a job at BORN is relaxed worklife
cons: Medical insurance for parents needs to be included under the medical insurance scheme. Even, if there is a deduction from individual employee's salary on insurance for parents it should be arranged. This is just my observation, though I am a contract employee

headline: excellent for eCommerce opportunities
pros:
Born has given me the opportunity to learn and develop eCommerce applications, I had no idea what Hybris was and yet the management placed trust on me and allowed me to learn. The senior developers were really helpful through out the development. Now there is even cross training between various eCommerce applications which will only add to individual's profile.Born is the place to be if you are looking to work in the growing eCommerce world.

The leadership team is amazingly supportive.
cons: Wish there was a structured HR management and the work hours were a stretch(probably the client I worked was demanding).

headline: Great opportunities
pros: Fast growth, and great opportunities for the talented and smart people
cons: Lead time in finding the lateral talents, due to niche platforms

headline: Fabulous place to work
pros:
- Rapidly growing organization employing leading edge technology in eCommerce presenting plethora of opportunity to learn and grow
- Talent recognized and rewarded. People are on continuous enrichment programs on their way to technical excellence
- Excited customers engage BORN for eCommerce implementation for their other brands
- Industry recognized CEO who is repeating his success story at BORN
cons: - Growing too fast. Will need to hire more to meet the demands.

headline: Good company to Work
pros:
Good Work Life Balance,
Best place to start the career, 
Good learning exposure and training provided.
Great opportunities to work in advanced technologies.
cons: Nothing much to specify here!

headline: Good company to start your career
pros: If you work hard and passionate about your work, you can grow very quickly in this organization. Good knowledgeable people who are always willing to help. Constant improvement in your current skills. Good exposure to New technologies. If you work smart, you can go places
cons: Nothing much to specify here!.....

headline: a place to grow, as company grows!!!
pros:
Have been here for more than 3 years now
1. Nice work culture
2. Employee friendly environment
3. Good work done
cons: Nothing much to mention except that the company is growing too fast and not sure about the career path.

headline: Opportunity to Learn, Work & Grow
pros:
Transparency between Management & Employee. Management is very approachable.
New challenges give opportunity to learn.
Opportunity for on-site is high. 
The policy like Certification Enhancement, Flexible working hours and Medical Insurance are plus points.
Work culture is very friendly.
It focuses on Employee Engagement as well. Every month there will be some activities like Pedalathon, festival celebrations, Painting Competition, Team lunch, Fun Friday, etc.  
Altogether a very good Company to Learn, Work & Grow.
cons: Comp-Off option is very rare.

headline: Amazing work culture!
pros: You come across alot of young chaps & talented people inside the company. Open door policy is the biggest strength and they are just amazing.
cons: Nothing much to specify here!

headline: Not a good place to work
pros: Nothing I can think about.
cons: There is no freedom and flexibility. If you like flexibility do not join BORN

headline: One of the best company to work with
pros:
Very good and reputed company.
Best Learning Atmosphere
Employee friendly policies 
Tremendous learning opportunities.
Excellent training through third party trainers.
cons: Nothing Specific to mention about BORN

headline: Chaotic with no Proper Structure
pros: The scope for growth here is pretty good.
cons: The Top management doesn't care much about the employees

headline: Great place to work & grow!
pros: BORN is an amazing place to work and it gives you all the space to grow & explore. A company that is filled with loads of young & energetic talents .. Keep up the work team!
cons: I dont find any , apart from better pantry.

headline: Company with full of energy and opportunities!!!
pros:
Firstly, the environment. You can never get bogged down with the kind of people you have around here. Always vibrant and on the toes. 
Secondly, the challenges. You will be tested with different challenges which will help you to elevate yourself to the global standards.
Thirdly, flat hierarchy. You are free to walk into anyone's room and suggest what you have in mind for which you will be encouraged rather than questioning who are you to say this.
cons:
Cafeteria can be improved.
High time the company should start looking for a another set-up as the current office space is getting crowded.

headline: Leasing Consultant
pros: Small company, ownership is "present" but not looking over your shoulder
cons: Small company, small onsite staffs, with large distances between locations, so room to advance within the company is next to impossible.

headline: Awesome place to learn and grow
pros:
Good learning opportunity
Open for new ideas
High visibility
Good work culture
Leadership team is aggressive and people concerned
Learning opportunities and self development is possible
cons:
Cons are individual centric. It is how they convert cons into Pros.
Every organization has it ups and down.

headline: Niche Company to work for
pros: It is one of the BEST companies to work if you are looking for career growth. It is a small company terms of strength but massive in terms of talent. The employees are friendly and are willing to help you to excel. The only thing is you must be open to accept challenges b'cos everyday will be like an action movie with different twist and turns. Some of the policies they have are quite impressive. The Management has an OPEN door policy and they really are approachable for any of the employee issues/query/suggestions. I had to move on due to family reasons but I truly miss this company and colleagues......
cons: I never had anything negative about the company

headline: Software Engineer-Intern
pros: good team of  technical people.Nice Hrs work life balance.value for your talent
cons: i couldnt find any.its a good company

headline: Not a best place to work
pros: Good combination of technology and business
cons:
Micro management by the top management
No vision/strategic plans.
Poor Project managers - in literal sense

headline: I worked as intern at borngroup for less than a year
pros:
They provide good environment to learn and develop career. 
Excellent training through third party trainers.
cons: Office space in chennai is crowded like some local bazaar. Sometimes you may not even get a chair.

headline: A place to learn something new
pros:
I'v been working with BORN for the past 6+ months, and the journey so far has been really good. A place with great work culture and environment. The projects I have worked so far didn't have any work pressure as such, but again depends on each project and their timelines. 

The employees are entitled to do a certification course which will be compensated from their variable pay (something good that I haven't seen in MNCs I worked so far).
cons: Haven't found anything so far.

headline: Great Potential for Growth
pros: The Growth factor here is very good and there are some good projects coming in.
cons: The time Estimates for the projects are pretty low, so there is pressure on the employees

headline: Great Kick Start to Make a Career
pros: Gave an excellent opening to my career, i started here as a fresher and gained considerable technical know how into ecommerce in span of 2 years. Got the opportunity to work with a couple of a really premium brands. Top management people like Prakash Gurumoorthy and Nathan were very approachable. World class infrastructure.
cons: nothing specific to mention BORN

headline: BORN - THE place to work in Ecommerce Industry
pros:
Makes one learn & practice the cutting edge technologies in ecommerce
Best of 2 worlds - Start up culture blended with sound management guidance
Mid managers & above are accorded complete ownership towards the projects & processes
Visionary steer of the company by its APAC MD Prakash Gurumoorthy & CEO Dilip Keshu
Transparent communication from senior management
Very closer proximity to city center (Chennai); 99.99% of MNCs in Chennai are flung far away
cons: Despite new & modern facilities, the place is a bit crowded but that is because of the rapid expansion company is going through

headline: Fast Growing E-Commerce development company
pros:
Good Environment
U can gain good E-commerce experience
cons:
Not following proper process
No onsite for QA

headline: Excellent and suitable place to work and learn for freshers
pros: Excellent Culture, Good people,Values Employee Satisfaction,employee friendly organizations.“Work-life balance is really connected to the culture of an organization hence am satisfied in all aspects.The flexible working hours, Cool managers, Amazing Colleagues makes work time more interesting.
cons: As per company standards,less salary for beginners !

headline: Best place to work
pros: It Have good environment for all employees. Giving course and exam for employees
cons: They dont provide suffecient source for project work environment is very goos

headline: "Good Atmosphere Good Communication"
pros: Having associated with company recently as java developer which is known for it rich Hybris resources. Hybris is a niche platform which will help me further as a java developer to have a great career growth.The thing that impressed me a lot was i received a bouquet before my joining & the templates i received on different purposes was also motivating.
cons:
None as of now.
May be improvement on branding can be done

headline: Good company, work life balance maintained....
pros: Good company, work life balance maintained, learnt E-comm domain technologies widely.
cons: No cons as such, processes can be included...

headline: A perfect haven for any aspirant to constantly evolve as per the ever-changing Corporate landscape!
pros: An uber work environ  & management-level responsibility given to each person at BORN provides an individual exemplary ways to acquire new skills and explore one's professional horizons. Our managers are friendly, which allows us to build a good rapport with them, and moreover,  a plethora of group activities hosted by our HRs keep us engaged and keep boredom at bay!!
cons: In order to get the best out of your experience at BORN, one has to be really precise, proactive & consistent in your performance. If you CAN master these attributes, there ain't no 'CON'  here.

headline: Good place for career growth
pros: I have been working here since the beginning of 2015, and having been from Java background, I have been trained in Hybris. For someone looking to learn, BORN is a great place providing ample opportunities to learn and develop. It is at an exciting juncture growing rapidly, and this is a nice time to be a part of BORN
cons: Lack of stability. Since it is growing very fast, things are not stable yet. Hopefully they will be soon

headline: Immense opportunities for professional learning and growth
pros: The young, vibrant work environment at BORN offers a number of opportunities for professional learning and growth. I have been working at BORN as an eCommerce Project Manager for a little over 1.5 years now, and each day continues to bring the excitement of new challenges, exposure to the latest technology and industry practices and fulfillment at work. It is a pleasure and a privilege to be a part of this organization.
cons:
Nothing as such.
One of the many strengths of this company is its flat organizational structure which brings out the best work from the employees. Introducing too many layers of hierarchy as the organization expands may dilute the open work culture.

headline: Good company with Bad people
pros:
Flexible timing
opportunity for self-learning
At least had a good developers to travel along
cons:
Worst management 
Worst VPs who doesn't know whats going on or who is working and who not
Organization is full of politics where everyone work hard to make their life comfortable and they can do anything for that.. 
They have lost great talents by their politics which company may or may not know..

headline: Sucks
pros: There's no best reason to work at BORN GROUP. Unless your a moran
cons: There's no structural leadership style . Demoralizing company no future

headline: Not a good work culture
pros: Loads of work. so, you can learn new technologies very soon.
cons:
No work life balance
They will make you work for 10 hours a day. hardly their team size will be 10 and not more than that for any project
As a smaller organization they are known for hire and fire policy, they can hire and they can fire people very easily.
If you are quitting a bigger organization like TCS, Wipro, HP and joining here think twice.

headline: Challenging Interesting Growing
pros: A small big company. Good technology exposure. Great training program. Expanding geographically.   Soothing work culture and cool management.
cons: None as of now - may be BORN as brand marketing is less

headline: Best Place to Work!!
pros:
Freedom to suggest.
Notified by Senior/Top Management on accomplishments
Growth on career aspects.
cons: no cons to share here.

headline: Born to Win
pros: Its a gud place to work with more fun and enjoyment. I have learnt lot of things from my experience in Born Group. It gave me more challenging opportunities to improve and prove my skills
cons: Nothing. No cons to say

headline: Driving the ecommerce way, creative people unimaginable talentpool
pros:
Excellent team for working with.
Challenging work environment. 
Good Technical Exposure,
good Work/Culture, Growth, Opportunities, Rewards .
Innovative and dynamic people to work around
cons: Attendance is being tracked and not much work from home policy.

headline: Loving my job!!
pros:
- Freedom to work on the platforms you choose to
- Friendly Managers
- No-bench policy (you always have work, all the year)
- Training and Certification policies
- Employee engagement programs
cons: - Considering the Pros, the Cons can be neglected!!

headline: Great environment that no one regrets!
pros: Its been an year since I have started working here and the work life over here have been fantastic; I have got to learn a lot from my team and have improved my skills too! The environment is really great for anyone who works here.
cons: So far I have not seen any!

headline: Great company with tons of potential
pros: I've been working with Born Group since 2013. I find Born to be a growing tech company with career opportunities in various platforms. Born Group is ever evolving and changing & provides an entrepreneurial opportunity for those seeking new challenges and opportunities to learn and develop. Good company, Excellent policies and fuels your career growth if you stick to the company.
cons: I didn't find anything so far.

headline: Good Place to Work with Some Big Challenges
pros: Growing company loaded with opportunities, Steep learning curve
cons: Unstructured working at times makes working difficult

headline: Good exposure and work culture!
pros: Approachable management, Good exposure, Good visibility
cons: Not applicable for this company

headline: Big Surprises in a Small Group!!!! And that's on a positive note
pros: Good Culture and work environment. Team members have been very supportive. Team work is given a lot of importance. Lots of opportunities.
cons: Small cons are there but thats the story in every company...

headline: Growing organization, which is helping me to grow
pros:
- Growth is exponential, on these one year
- Management
- Work life balance
- Good compensation
- Better HR Team ( comparing to my previous organizations)
- Career opportunities with organization is commendable if you are interested in Digital Marketing
- No week end work
- FUN AND CELEBRATIONS
- Learning Opportunities
cons:
- Employee engagement is little less comparing to other MNC's 
- Working shift could be rotational
- Onsite opportunity
- Challenging work
- Global communication

headline: Great culture and ample resources to expand your knowledge
pros:
- Good Work Culture, east to handle and  Balance Work life pressure 
- Flexible timings 
- Great support and encouragement to define a path in career
- Good reorganization for performance 
- Training and exposures to latest technologies 
- Pleasant atmosphere
cons: Zero cons to be mentioned..

headline: Unique, Interesting and Progressive
pros: BORN Group is an interesting workplace with its vision to provide a unique package of creative, content and commerce services. Being part of a rapidly growing company throws a number of challenges which opens door for new learning everyday. Grab the opportunities thrown at you and you are sure to grow rapidly, for the recognition by the leadership team is highly commendable. With great, approachable and fearless leaders, BORN is definitely a must-have experience.
cons:
Great HR Team but better ER will be much welcomed.  
The company is very accomodative of its employees, but the constant "What Next?" factor is a let down at times.

headline: Dynamic company with lots of career progression opportunities.
pros:
Great working environment, with very friendly team atmosphere.
Company utilizes a MSO facility in Chennai, which is wholly-owned by them and they treat their staff very well.
Management tier is passionate about what it does and it resonates downwards.
All global production hubs are staffed with highly skilled and competent staff. This makes a huge difference to efficient delivery.
cons: None. I thoroughly enjoy the BORN experience.

headline: Been there less than a year
pros: Company has good projects Hybris people have good projects
cons: Management is worst here. Many politics and domination are going here.  Nobody will recognize our work.  No use in giving our efforts.
